intro: Myrobalanus australis, commonly known as the Australian tamarind, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhizophoraceae and is characterized by its thick, fissured bark and small, glossy leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, orange-red fruits that are rich in tannins. Its fruit is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dye. Myrobalanus australis is adapted to coastal environments and can thrive in saline soils.
